root.para: Entities that engage in financial instrument transactions frequently outsource tasks related to those transactions to other entities (for example, broker-dealers, investment advisers, and custodians). AU-C section 402B refers to such entities as service organizations and defines a as an organization or a segment of an organization that provides services to user entities that are relevant to those user entitiesâ€™ internal control over financial reporting. A is defined as an entity that uses a service organization and whose financial statements are being audited. A is defined as an auditor who audits and reports on the financial statements of a user entity. service organization user entity user auditor
